Html: it appears that if a @import declaration doesn't work.  If i put one on top of a .chirp.less file it doesn't seem to included that in the parsing.  the file is located in the same folder as the .chirp.less file.  I have tried using a standard .less extension on the file to import as well as a .chirp.less (but i don't need this to be precessed into css so using a standard .less extension would be great.

Hey jwscuba,

Have you checked out this thread: http://groups.google.com/group/dotless/browse_thread/thread/488e4fdbc219b0c8

I'll copy the pertinent comment (as I, too, was confused...): "If the extension is ".css" dotless will output the @import statement as is."

So, only .less imports will get imported by the DotLess translator, and .css imports will be placed as-is into the css file. Does that make sense? I've tested @import *.less, and the imports do get appropriately translated into standard css.

Sorry for the delay on this. If you're still experiencing issues, let me know. I'll be releasing a cleaner version of the Add-In today. So, if all else fails... :)

Cheers,
Evan
